citation.article-title: Chemotaxonomic and phylogenetic analyses of Sphingomonas strains isolated from ears of plants in the family Gramineae and a proposal of Sphingomonas roseoflava sp. nov.
citation.source: The Journal of General and Applied Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sphingomonas roseoflava sp. nov.
Sphingomonas roseoflava (ro.se.o.fla'va. L. adj. roseus rose colored; L. adj. flavus yellow; N. L. fem. adj. roseoflava rose-yellow)
Sphingomonas roseoflava is a gram-negative, nonsporing, rod-shaped organism.
Colonies are smooth, convex, and pink-yellow.
Ribonuclease, indophenol oxidase, and catalase are positive.
D-Mannitol, caprate, and phenylacetate are not assimilated.
The G+C content of the DNA is 66–68 mol%.
Ubiquinone Q-10 is the sole respiratory quinone.
Major nonpolar fatty acids are C18:1, C16:1, and C16:0.
Two types of glycosphingolipid are present.
One contains glucuronic acid, and the other glucuronic acid, glucosamine, and hexoses.
The sole fatty acid in its glycosphingolipids is 2-OH-C14:0, and major sphingosines are dihydrosphingosine 18:0 and dihydrosphingosine 21cycl.
The phylogenetic position is in the α-4 subclass of Proteobacteria.
Source: frequently isolated from the ear of Setaria viridis.
